intro: Trichobasis, commonly known as the hairgrass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its fine, hair-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. These plants are typically found in moist, temperate environments such as wet meadows and riverbanks. Trichobasis species often have rhizomes that help in spreading and stabilizing soil. Their botanical features make them important in ecological systems for erosion control and habitat provision.
